scenarios.label: Baseline / Recommended
scenarios.description: Centralized log archive using Azure Storage (Blob) with lifecycle management to Cool and Archive, GRS redundancy, and basic monitoring and security.

resources.notes: Single VNet for private access to storage and monitoring components. No direct cost but required for network topology.

Azure Blob Storage account with GRS redundancy as required. Assumes 20 TB/month ingest into Hot; lifecycle moves data to Cool after 30 days and Archive after 180 days. For steady state, approximated 20 TB Hot (last month), 80 TB Cool (previous 4 months), 40 TB Archive (previous 2 months). 2 TB/month egress for occasional log access and restore. 200M operations/month (write, list, read) as a rough estimate. Standard_GRS SKU used; lifecycle policies configured at container level.
resources.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration, Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration, Archive Data Write
resources.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace, Blob Storage

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 Hierarchical Namespace

resources.notes: Internet egress for log access and downloads. Assumes 2 TB/month outbound from the storage account to external consumers or other regions.
resources.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Standard Key Vault for storage account keys, customer-managed keys (CMK) if required, and secrets for ingestion pipelines. 200k operations/month assumed.
Log Analytics workspace for monitoring the storage account, ingestion jobs, and access logs. Assumes 500 GB/month ingestion into Log Analytics (separate from blob archive) with 30-day retention.

Recovery Services vault for configuration backups (e.g., policies, scripts, small metadata). Not intended to back up the full 20 TB/month log data, which is already protected via GRS and lifecycle tiers. 200 GB backup storage assumed.

scenarios.label: Cost Optimized
scenarios.description: Centralized log archive with GRS, but more aggressive use of Cool and Archive tiers and reduced monitoring/egress assumptions to minimize cost.

resources.notes: Same logical VNet as baseline; no direct cost.

Same 20 TB/month ingest with GRS, but more aggressive lifecycle: assume only ~10 TB kept in Hot (shorter hot retention via earlier move to Cool), 60 TB in Cool, 60 TB in Archive to reduce cost. Lower egress (1 TB/month) and fewer operations (150M/month) assumed to reflect cost-conscious access patterns.
resources.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration, Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration, Archive Data Write

resources.notes: Key Vault with fewer operations (100k/month) by caching secrets in clients where appropriate.
Smaller Log Analytics footprint (200 GB/month) with tighter retention and sampling to reduce cost. Still used for operational monitoring, not for full log archive.
Smaller Recovery Services vault (150 GB) for configuration and metadata backups only. No full data duplication beyond GRS.

scenarios.label: High Performance / Heavy Access
scenarios.description: Centralized log archive with GRS, optimized for higher read access and analytics on recent data, with more data kept in Hot and higher egress/operations.

resources.notes: Same VNet concept; may host additional analytics services if needed.

Same 20 TB/month ingest with GRS, but more data retained in Hot (e.g., extended hot retention for analytics, approximated 30 TB Hot, 70 TB Cool, 40 TB Archive). Higher egress (5 TB/month) and many more operations (400M/month) to reflect frequent querying and rehydration of logs.
resources.meter_name: Hot Data Returned for Query Acceleration, Cool Data Scanned for Query Acceleration, Archive Data Write

resources.notes: Higher outbound traffic (5 TB/month) for downstream analytics systems, external SIEMs, or cross-region consumers.

sku_candidates.meter_name: Standard Inter-Availability Zone Data Transfer Out

resources.notes: Key Vault with higher operation volume (400k/month) due to more clients and services accessing secrets and keys.
Larger Log Analytics workspace (1 TB/month) to support richer monitoring, alerting, and some query workloads on recent logs, separate from the long-term archive in Blob.

Recovery Services vault with slightly higher backup storage (300 GB) to cover additional configuration and metadata for high-performance analytics components if present. Still not backing up the full log dataset, which relies on GRS and lifecycle tiers.
